definition: (interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin

sentences.english: “It’s like a home cooked meal for me, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: “嘻哈音樂對我來說就像一頓家鄉大餐，”他說。

sentences.english: I used to listen to a lot of hip-hop music and heavy metal when I was younger.
sentences.chinese: 我年輕的時候，我常常聽一些嘻哈和重金屬音樂。

sentences.english: The vast majority of pioneers in the hip hop industry have been African-American and Latino.
sentences.chinese: 嘻哈業內的大部分先驅者都是非裔美國人和拉丁人。

sentences.english: To have the time to work on basketball, you probably should cut out Hip Hop Dance Class.
sentences.chinese: 要有時間打籃球，你就得退出嘻哈舞蹈班。

sentences.english: Mr McWhorter, a fellow of the Manhattan Institute, a conservative think-tank, is a hip-hop fan.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，麥克沃特先生本人就是一個嘻哈樂迷。

sentences.english: I love jazz and opera. And also hip-hop.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡爵士樂和歌劇，還有嘻哈音樂。

sentences.english: The Mister Freeze hip-hop dance move is a floor step.
sentences.chinese: 凍結的先生嘻哈舞步是一個樓層的一步。

sentences.english: Those who disapprove of it vastly overestimate its capacity to corrupt.
sentences.chinese: 那些極爲反感它的人高估了”嘻哈”的腐蝕性。

sentences.english: Hip-pop culture will not stop when time cha veryge.
sentences.chinese: 嘻哈文明永遠不會由於時間而停止改造。

sentences.english: Hip-pop culture will not stop when time cha strongge.
sentences.chinese: 嘻哈文明永遠不會由於時間而停止改換。

sentences.english: Mash-up albums and videos have been a huge hit on the internet.
sentences.chinese: 嘻哈的相冊和錄像對互聯網是個巨大的衝擊。

sentences.english: Do you agree Hip Hop is a good method for you to promote self-image?
sentences.chinese: 你同意嘻哈舞蹈是一個好方法以提升自我形象嗎？

sentences.english: Hip-Hop Style, Fashion Trendsetter, Street Style;
sentences.chinese: 嘻哈風格，潮流指標，街頭風尚。

sentences.english: Now, hip-hop is all over the world and people love it.
sentences.chinese: 現在，全球都流行嘻哈樂，很多人都喜歡嘻哈。

sentences.english: The term hip-hop music created by African Americans as a slang.
sentences.chinese: 嘻哈這個詞是由美國黑人創造出來的一個俚語。

sentences.english: The language of hip-hop culture is an extension of past and recent vernacular.
sentences.chinese: 嘻哈文化的語言是過去和新近流行詞語的延伸。

definition: speaking and singing, as in various forms of storytelling such as 彈詞|弹词[tan2 ci2] and 相聲|相声[xiang4 sheng5]/(music) rapping
Cui Jian (1961-), father of Chinese rock music
talkative/to blather/to shoot one's mouth off/rap (genre of music)
